intro: Schellolepis terrestris, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. Schellolepis terrestris is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
